ðŸŒŸ YouPlot | Ruby
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To quickly visualize data in the terminal without needing a graphical interface, making it useful for command-line workflows and data exploration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Draws plots directly in the terminal â€¢ Supports bar, histogram, line, scatter, density, and box plots â€¢ Processes data from standard input (piped data) â€¢ Handles CSV and TSV data formats â€¢ Configurable plot dimensions and titles
ðŸ“– Summary: YouPlot is a command-line tool written in Ruby that generates various types of plots directly within the terminal. It leverages UnicodePlot to render visualizations from data piped into it, supporting formats like TSV and CSV.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ agentkit | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building AI agents that can perform on-chain cryptocurrency transactions and interact with DeFi protocols without requiring users to hold native tokens for gas fees.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Framework-agnostic AI Agent primitives â€¢ Support for Python and Node.js â€¢ Gasless Transactions â€¢ Account Abstraction (ERC-4337) â€¢ Multi-Chain Support (BSC, Avalanche, Base, Sonic, Moonbeam)
ðŸ“– Summary: AgentKit is a TypeScript toolkit enabling AI agents to interact with blockchain networks and DeFi protocols. It facilitates gasless transactions and account abstraction on EVM chains, allowing agents to manage funds, trade tokens, and deploy smart contracts using natural language.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ waveterm | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enhance developer productivity by integrating graphical tools and AI assistance directly into the terminal environment, reducing context switching.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Flexible drag & drop interface for organizing terminal blocks, editors, web browsers, and AI assistants â€¢ Built-in editor for remote files with syntax highlighting
ðŸ“– Summary: Wave Terminal is an open-source, cross-platform terminal application that integrates traditional command-line functionality with graphical tools like file previews, web browsing, and AI assistance. It aims to keep developers within their terminal workflow while providing access to essential visual interfaces.
